field.label: IP Address Field for Order Data
field.comment: Order field to use as value for IP address during sync.
field.tooltip: By default, Klevu considers the remote_ip field of table sales_order for tracking the shopper's IP in the checkout data. If the website is using the x_forwarded_for field from sales_order, please select the X Forwarded For option.

field.label: Order Record Max Sync Attempts
field.comment: Maximum number of times an order record will be tried before being considered failed.
field.tooltip:
If synchronisation for an order record fails (including connection issues, validate failures, or application errors), it will be requeued for sync in a subsequent batch.
After the configured maximum attempts have failed, the order will be marked as failed and no subsequent attempts will be made unless the record is manually requeued.

field.label: Consider Processing Orders Stuck After (minutes)
field.comment: Stuck orders are requeued or marked as failed automatically.
field.tooltip: Occasionally, an order sync process may fail and exit before a record can be marked as processed (or failed). In order for these records to be picked up for processing in subsequent jobs, a cron job will assume them as stuck and requeue after the configured number of minutes since the last action recorded.

field.label: Remove History for Successfully Synced Orders After (days)
field.tooltip:
If you have a high volume of orders and are experiencing resource or performance issues as the klevu_sync_order_history table fills up, you can specify a maximum number of days for which to retain history.
History items older than this interval will be pruned via cron once a day.
This setting applies to successfully synced orders.

field.label: Remove History for Failed Synced Orders After (days)
field.tooltip:
If you have a high volume of orders and are experiencing resource or performance issues as the klevu_sync_order_history table fills up, you can specify a maximum number of days for which to retain history.
History items older than this interval will be pruned via cron once a day.
This setting applies to orders which failed to sync after the configured maximum attempts.
